member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.ServerRpcDelegate
member.summary: Defines a delegate that a client uses to call a method on the server.
member.remarks: Any method which will be invoked via the call must use this delegate signature.

example.code:
' Sample showing invocation of server method Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager Dim orderId As Integer = 10250 Dim mailSent As Boolean = CBool(pm.InvokeServerMethod(Order.EmailOrderInfo, orderId))
' sample method defined in Order class Public Class Order : Inherits OrderDataRow '... Public Shared<AllowRpc()> _ Function EmailOrderInfo(pPrincipal As IPrincipal, pResolver As DataSourceResolver, ParamArray pArgs() As [Object]) As [Object] Dim orderId As Integer = Convert.ToInt32(pArgs(0))
' build and send an email message Dim from As String = "sales@mycompany.com" Dim [to] As String = "customer@yourcompany.com" Dim msg As New System.Net.Mail.MailMessage(from, [to])
msg.Subject = "Order Information" msg.Body = String.Format("Order id = {0} has been shipped", orderId)
Dim client As New System.Net.Mail.SmtpClient("localhost") Try client.Send(msg) Catch e As Exception TraceFns.WriteLine(e.Message) Return False End Try Return True End Function End Class

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.ServerRpcPersistenceDelegate
member.summary: Defines a delegate that a client uses to call a method on the server.
member.remarks: Any method which will be invoked via the call must use this delegate signature.

example.code:
' Sample showing invocation of server method Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager Dim orderId As Integer = 10250 Dim mailSent As Boolean = CBool(pm.InvokeServerMethod(Order.EmailOrderInfo, orderId))
' sample method defined in Order class Public Class Order : Inherits OrderDataRow '... Public Shared<AllowRpc()> _ Function EmailOrderInfo(pPrincipal As IPrincipal, pResolver As DataSourceResolver, ParamArray pArgs() As [Object]) As [Object] Dim orderId As Integer = Convert.ToInt32(pArgs(0))
' build and send an email message Dim from As String = "sales@mycompany.com" Dim [to] As String = "customer@yourcompany.com" Dim msg As New System.Net.Mail.MailMessage(from, [to])
msg.Subject = "Order Information" msg.Body = String.Format("Order id = {0} has been shipped", orderId)
Dim client As New System.Net.Mail.SmtpClient("localhost") Try client.Send(msg) Catch e As Exception TraceFns.WriteLine(e.Message) Return False End Try Return True End Function End Class

member.summary: Find rows is implemented.

member.name: F:IdeaBlade.Persistence.FindRowsResultMode.RequiresDataSourceMerge
member.summary: Result of FindRows will be incomplete unless the results from the data source query are merged with it.
member.remarks: This currently only happens with an with subqueries and set to true. In this case the result of FindRows may not return all of the objects in the cache that do in fact meet its criteria because some of the dependent objects may not be available.

member.summary: The FindRows is implemented using some form of subquery navigation.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.IIdentityIdGenerator
member.summary: Interface for generation of unique IDs for new objects having Identity columns.
member.remarks: This interface is primarily intended as a marker interface to support the default implementation of the , but users can implement custom classes if necessary.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.IIdGenerator
member.summary: Interface for generation of unique IDs for new objects.
member.remarks:
The IIdGenerator interface defines methods to generate both temporary and real IDs for objects, and to map the temporary IDs to real IDs when objects are persisted to a backend data source. Temporary IDs are created via a call to , and allow entities to be created and uniquely identified while the PersistenceManager is disconnected from a backend database. Temporary IDs are mapped to real IDs during processing.
Sample code in both VB.NET and C# showing an implementation for ID values of the long datatype is provided with the DevForce installation.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.IIdGenerator.IsApplicable(IdeaBlade.Util.IDataSourceKey)
member.summary: Returns whether the IdGenerator can be used with the specified data source key.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.IIdGenerator.GetNextTempId(IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityColumn)
member.summary: Generates a new temporary ID for a specified EntityColumn.
member.param: Column for which a new ID should be generated
member.returns: A new temporary ID
member.remarks:
The definition of a "temporary" ID is user-defined. In the sample code for a "LongIdGenerator" negative integers are used as temporary IDs.
This method should also store the temporary IDs generated in a .

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.IIdGenerator.IsTempId(IdeaBlade.Persistence.UniqueId)
member.summary: Determines whether a given ID is temporary.
member.returns: true if the ID is temporary; otherwise false
member.remarks: The contains the ID to be tested. You can use the property of the to determine the type.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.IIdGenerator.Reset
member.summary: Reset temporary ID generation back to its initial state.
member.remarks: Called by the after Id fixup during processing.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.IIdGenerator.GetRealIdMap(IdeaBlade.Persistence.UniqueIdCollection,IdeaBlade.Util.IDataSourceKey)
member.summary: Returns a dictionary that maps temporary IDs to real IDs.
member.remarks:
In the returned, the key contains the temporary ID, while the value holds the real ID.
GetRealIdMap is called by the during processing. The collection of temporary IDs passed in may contain entries for multiple entity types. You can use the passed to manage access to the backend data source to determine real IDs.
The definition of a "real" ID is user-defined.

member.name: P:IdeaBlade.Persistence.IIdGenerator.TempIds
member.summary: Returns the temporary IDs generated since instantiation of this class or the last .

member.name: P:IdeaBlade.Persistence.IIdentityIdGenerator.NextIdGenerator
member.summary: Gets or sets the fallback to be used.
member.remarks: This value is set by the from dynamically loaded assemblies, and is not required.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntitySpan
member.summary: A chained collection of s used to create a span query.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntitySpan.#ctor(System.Type,IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityRelation[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the EntitySpan class.

example.code: Private Sub BuildingEntitySpans() ' Load all employees with birthdates before 1970 ' span 1 - all associated orders, all associated order details, and all associated Products ' span 2 - all associated Customers Dim query As New RdbQuery(GetType(Employee), Employee.BirthDateEntityColumn, EntityQueryOp.LT, New DateTime(1970, 1, 1)) Dim span1 As New EntitySpan(query.EntityType, EntityRelations.Employee_Order, EntityRelations.Order_OrderDetail, EntityRelations.Product_OrderDetail) Dim span2 As New EntitySpan(query.EntityType, EntityRelations.Employee_Order, EntityRelations.Customer_Order) System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine(String.Format("span 1 from {0} to {1}", span1.FromType.Name, span1.ToType.Name)) query.AddSpan(span1) query.AddSpan(span2) Dim employees As EntityList(Of Employee) = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager.GetEntities(Of Employee)(query) End Sub

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntitySpan.#ctor(IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityRelationLink[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the EntitySpan class.
member.param: One or more entity relation links

example.code: Private Sub BuildingEntitySpans() ' Load all employees with birthdates before 1970 ' span 1 - all associated orders, all associated order details, and all associated Products ' span 2 - all associated Customers Dim query As New RdbQuery(GetType(Employee), Employee.BirthDateEntityColumn, EntityQueryOp.LT, New DateTime(1970, 1, 1)) Dim span1 As New EntitySpan(query.EntityType, EntityRelations.Employee_Order, EntityRelations.Order_OrderDetail, EntityRelations.Product_OrderDetail) Dim span2 As New EntitySpan(query.EntityType, EntityRelations.Employee_Order, EntityRelations.Customer_Order) System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine(String.Format("span 1 from {0} to {1}", span1.FromType.Name, span1.ToType.Name)) query.AddSpan(span1) query.AddSpan(span2) Dim employees As EntityList(Of Employee) = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager.GetEntities(Of Employee)(query) End Sub

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.RemotingPersistenceService
member.summary: Internal use only. This class supports the DevForce Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
member.remarks:
A single instance of this class resides on the Business Object Server and receives and responds to requests from the s on each client.
The PersistenceService is configured using the defined in IdeaBlade.ibconfig or using an app.config (web.config in IIS) file. The RemotingPersistenceService uses .NET Remoting for distributed communications.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceService
member.summary: Internal use only. This class supports the DevForce Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
member.remarks:
A single instance of this class resides on the Business Object Server and receives and responds to requests from the s on each client.
The PersistenceService is configured using the defined in IdeaBlade.ibconfig or using an app.config (web.config in IIS) file. The CommunicationsTechnology setting determines whether communication between clients and this service uses .NET remoting or Windows Communication Foundation.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityQuery
member.summary: Standard mechanism for performing business object queries.
member.remarks:
You can use an EntityQuery to build the Object Query Language (OQL) to retrieve your business objects. OQL syntax provides a SQL-agnostic, strongly-typed means of querying objects from a .
An EntityQuery is essentially a stack of 's and 's that are processed as in an RPN calculator. Each clause represents a single simple query phrase such as "Age > 40". Clauses by default are "ANDed" together, but you can use the to form "OR" and "NOT" compound clauses. Use instead of a SQL join to add query criteria for attributes on related objects.
Queries are built using the , and methods. You may use the method to order the returned results, especially useful when selecting only the number of results to be returned.
You can use a to determine whether the query results will be retrieved from cache or from a backend datasource. Queries are executed using the
and methods.
Note: For some entity types, including those backed by a non-relational data source, an EntityQuery might return only cached data, and be unusable against the data source. In these situations you will need to use the query appropriate to the entity type (e.g., , ).

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityQuery.AddOrderBy(IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityColumn)
member.summary: Adds an to the query to order returned data by the specified column.
member.param: Entity column to order results by
member.remarks:
Returned data will be ordered in ascending sequence.
You may add multiple statements to a query to order the returned data by multiple columns.

example.code:
Private Sub SampleEntityOrderBy() Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager
' Retrieve customers ordered by city asc, companyname desc Dim query As New RdbQuery(GetType(Customer)) query.AddOrderBy(Customer.CityEntityColumn, ListSortDirection.Ascending) query.AddOrderBy(Customer.CompanyNameEntityColumn, ListSortDirection.Descending)
Dim customers As EntityList(Of Customer) = pm.GetEntities(Of Customer)(query)
' Note that the returned data was sorted, but the EntityList itself is not sorted ' and the sort order is not maintained as new items are added. System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine(customers.IsSorted.ToString())
For Each aCust As Customer In customers System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine((aCust.City + " " + aCust.CompanyName)) Next aCust End Sub

member.summary: Returns the list of s in the query.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityQuery.AddSpan(IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityRelationLink[])
member.summary: Adds an to the query for the specified EntityRelationLinks.
member.remarks:
The allows you to create a span query - a query which retrieves objects of the , plus any related objects as defined by the span targets.
If multiple s are passed, they must form a valid relationship chain from which nested subqueries can be built.

example.code:
Private Sub SampleSpanQuery() ' Sample span query using multiple EntitySpans. ' Retrieve Orders and related customers and order details. Dim query As New RdbQuery(GetType(Order)) query.AddClause(Order.OrderDateEntityColumn, EntityQueryOp.Between, _ New DateTime() {New DateTime(1997, 1, 1), New DateTime(1997, 3, 31)}) query.AddSpan(EntityRelations.Customer_Order) ' Get the Customers for these orders query.AddSpan(EntityRelations.Order_OrderDetail) ' Get the order details for these orders. Dim orders As EntityList(Of Order) = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager.GetEntities(Of Order)(query)
' Sample span query using a single EntitySpan with multiple links. ' Retrieve Customers and related orders, order details for the orders, and products for the order details. Dim query2 As New RdbQuery(GetType(Customer)) query2.AddClause(Customer.CompanyNameEntityColumn, EntityQueryOp.StartsWith, "A") query2.AddSpan(EntityRelations.Customer_Order, EntityRelations.Order_OrderDetail, EntityRelations.Product_OrderDetail) Dim customers As EntityList(Of Customer) = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager.GetEntities(Of Customer)(query2) End Sub

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityQuery.AddSpan(IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityRelation[])
member.summary: Adds an to the query for the specified EntityRelations.
member.remarks:
The allows you to create a span query - a query which retrieves objects of the , plus any related objects as defined by the span targets.
If multiple s are passed, they must form a valid relationship chain from which nested subqueries can be built.

example.code:
Private Sub SampleSpanQuery() ' Sample span query using multiple EntitySpans. ' Retrieve Orders and related customers and order details. Dim query As New RdbQuery(GetType(Order)) query.AddClause(Order.OrderDateEntityColumn, EntityQueryOp.Between, _ New DateTime() {New DateTime(1997, 1, 1), New DateTime(1997, 3, 31)}) query.AddSpan(EntityRelations.Customer_Order) ' Get the Customers for these orders query.AddSpan(EntityRelations.Order_OrderDetail) ' Get the order details for these orders. Dim orders As EntityList(Of Order) = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager.GetEntities(Of Order)(query)
' Sample span query using a single EntitySpan with multiple links. ' Retrieve Customers and related orders, order details for the orders, and products for the order details. Dim query2 As New RdbQuery(GetType(Customer)) query2.AddClause(Customer.CompanyNameEntityColumn, EntityQueryOp.StartsWith, "A") query2.AddSpan(EntityRelations.Customer_Order, EntityRelations.Order_OrderDetail, EntityRelations.Product_OrderDetail) Dim customers As EntityList(Of Customer) = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager.GetEntities(Of Customer)(query2) End Sub

Private Sub SampleSpanQuery() ' Sample span query using multiple EntitySpans. ' Retrieve Orders and related customers and order details. member.name: P:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityQuery.EnableUdfQueries
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this query will allow the querying of dynamic (user-defined) columns. Defaults to false. This feature is only available in certain editions of DevForce.
member.remarks:
When set to true, columns defined in the data source but not included as properties in the Entity can be used to build s.
If UDF fields will be used in a query set this value to true before adding any clauses to the query, and do not use any of the constructor overloads which implicitly build a query clause.

member.name: P:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityQuery.Top
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of entities to return from the query.
member.remarks: If the query includes one or more statements, the first N entities, ordered by the columns specified, are returned. If the query does not include an , the order of the entities is arbitrary.

example.code:
Private Sub SampleEntityQueryTop() Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager
' Retrieve the top 10 orders having the highest freight charge. Dim query As New RdbQuery(GetType(Order)) query.AddOrderBy(Order.FreightEntityColumn, ListSortDirection.Descending) query.Top = 10
Dim orders As IList(Of Order) = pm.GetEntities(Of Order)(query) For Each anOrder As Order In orders System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine((anOrder.Id.ToString() + "=" + anOrder.Freight.Value.ToString())) Next anOrder End Sub

member.name: P:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityQuery.CommandTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the wait time in seconds before terminating the attempt to execute a command and generating an error.
member.remarks:
A value of 0 indicates that the default timeout value for the data provider should be used - this is usually 30 seconds.
Note that the CommandTimeout is different from the , which is the maximum amount of time that the entire transaction can take. A single transaction may involve multiple commands.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceServerException
member.summary: Exception thrown for persistence failures.
member.remarks:
A PersistenceServerException, or one of its sub-types, can be thrown for a number of error conditions detected while the communicates with the . It can be raised during and processing, while fetching data through any of the GetEntity or GetEntities methods, or saving data via SaveChanges.
The PersistenceServerException is first raised via the event. If a handler is in place for this event you can choose to handle the error and set the property value to true. If a handler is not found or the Handled property is not set, the PersistenceServerException is thrown back to the calling code.
The of the exception indicates the general type of failure condition. The indicates the type of persistence operation requested when the error occurred. The will have additional information on the error.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityListManager`1
member.summary: Manages an to ensure the list stays current with specified filtering criteria.
member.remarks:
An EntityListManager turns an or into a "live" or managed list. By specifying a and the EntityListManager will ensure that any changes, additions or deletions to entities meeting the filtering criteria are automatically reflected in the list.
Use and to add or remove lists under management. All lists managed by an EntityListManager must contain the same Entity type.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityListManager`1.#ctor(IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager,System.Predicate{`0},IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityColumn[],System.Collections.IList,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the EntityListManager.
member.param: A predicate returning true if the tested entity belongs in the list
The watched columns. If supplied, changes to values in the watched columns trigger filtering. If null, any changes to Entities of this type will trigger filtering.
If true, immediately refresh the list for the filtering criteria
member.remarks:
The uses a .NET Predicate<T>, a delegate that defines a set of criteria and determines whether the specified object passed to it meets those criteria. The Filter receives every addition, deletion or modification (based on the specified) of entities of the type watched, and determines whether the entity belongs in the list. If the Filter returns true the entity is added to or kept in the list; if the Filter returns false the entity is removed from the list. (Note that entities removed from the managed list are not removed from the PersistenceManager, nor are they deleted.)
Performance will be needlessly poor if the EntityListManager tests an entity every time any of its columns change. To avoid this, specify in the constructor or the property which entity columns are relevant to the filtering.
You can choose to have the EntityListManager refresh the list immediately after assuming management of the list. This is unnecessary if the supplied list is known to be complete at the time the manager is initialized.

example.p: This example simulates the OrderDetails property of an Order entity.

There are four basic steps (1) retrieve the list using an RdbQuery, (2) define a filter, (3) add a manager to the list, and (4) wrap the list as a ReadOnlyEntityList so that only its manager can add and remove items.
example.P: Step3 #2 and #3 are the crux of the example.
example.code:
Private ReadOnlyEntityList<OrderDetail> mOrderDetails = null
''' <summary> ''' Gets the order details managed list populates it if not yet defined. ''' </summary> Private ReadOnlyEntityList<OrderDetail> GetOrderDetails() { if (mOrderDetails != null) return mOrderDetails
' Step #1: Query for OrderDetails with order id that matches this order's id RdbQuery query = New RdbQuery(typeof(OrderDetail), OrderDetail.OrderIdEntityColumn, EntityQueryOp.EQ, this.Id)
' Get details in an EntityList EntityList<OrderDetail> list = this.PersistenceManager.GetEntities<OrderDetail>(query)
' Step #2: Filter as Predicate delegate returns true if the detail object belongs to this order Predicate<OrderDetail> predicate = delegate(OrderDetail pDetail) { return pDetail.OrderId == this.Id }
' Step #3: Add a ListManager to the EntityList from the query ' Note how manager will only engage predicate if the OrderId changes ' as is appropriate for that filter. Other changes to OrderDetails will be ignored list.ListManager = New EntityListManager<OrderDetail>( this.PersistenceManager, list, predicate, New EntityColumn[] { OrderDetail.OrderIdEntityColumn }, false)
' Step #4: Wrap the list in a ReadOnlyEntityList and return it mOrderDetails = New ReadOnlyEntityList<OrderDetail>(list) return mOrderDetails }

Private mOrderDetails As ReadOnlyEntityList(Of OrderDetail) = Nothing
''' <summary> ''' Gets the order details managed list populates it if not yet defined. ''' </summary> Private Function GetOrderDetails() As ReadOnlyEntityList(Of OrderDetail) If Not mOrderDetails Is Nothing Then Return mOrderDetails End If
' Step #1: Query for OrderDetails with order id that matches this order's id Dim query As RdbQuery = _ New RdbQuery(GetType(OrderDetail), _ OrderDetail.OrderIdEntityColumn, _ EntityQueryOp.EQ, Me.Id)
' Get details in an EntityList Dim list As EntityList(Of OrderDetail) = _ Me.PersistenceManager.GetEntities(Of OrderDetail)(query)
' Step #2: Filter Dim myPredicate As Predicate(Of OrderDetail) = _ New Predicate(Of OrderDetail)(AddressOf OrderDetailFilter)
' Step #3: Add a ListManager to the EntityList from the query ' Note how manager will only engage predicate if the OrderId changes ' as is appropriate for that filter. Other changes to OrderDetails will be ignored list.ListManager = New EntityListManager(Of OrderDetail)( _ Me.PersistenceManager, _ list, _ myPredicate, _ New EntityColumn() {OrderDetail.OrderIdEntityColumn}, _ False)
' Step #4: Wrap the list in a ReadOnlyEntityList and return it mOrderDetails = New ReadOnlyEntityList(Of OrderDetail)(list) Return mOrderDetails End Function
' Predicate delegate returns true if the detail object belongs to this order Private Function OrderDetailFilter(ByVal pDetail As OrderDetail) As Boolean If pDetail.OrderId = Me.Id Then Return True Else Return False End If End Function

member.param: A predicate returning true if the tested entity belongs in the list

If the Filter returns true the entity is added to or kept in the list; if the Filter returns false the entity is removed from the list. member.summary: The list manager is responsible for insuring that any changes to the pm that should add to a given list do so. Any changes that should delete from the list are the responsibility of the list itself. The reason for this division of labor is that we need to test every list for the add of an item but only those lists that contain an item for deletes

member.summary: The list manager is responsible for insuring that any changes to the pm that should add to a given list do so. Any changes that should delete from the list are the responsibility of the list itself. The reason for this division of labor is that we need to test every list for the add of an item but only those lists that contain an item for deletes

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityQueryClause
member.summary: Represents a single phrase in an .
member.remarks: The EntityQueryClause is the primary constituent of an . Each clause represents a query phrase with a single , an and a value (or list of values).

example.code:
Private Sub SampleQueryClauses() ' Sample showing EntityQueryClause construction
Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager Dim query As EntityQuery
query = New EntityQuery(GetType(Order)) Dim clause1 As New EntityQueryClause(Order.FreightEntityColumn, EntityQueryOp.GT, 100) Dim clause2 As New EntityQueryClause(Order.ShipCityEntityColumn, EntityQueryOp.In, _ New String() {"Graz", "Lille"}) Dim clause3 As New EntityQueryClause(Order.RequiredDateEntityColumn, EntityQueryOp.GT, Order.ShippedDateEntityColumn)
query.AddClause(clause1) query.AddClause(clause2) query.AddCluase(clause3)
' Note that an EntityQuery will automatically be converted to an RdbQuery when accessing the data source. Dim orders As EntityList(Of Order) = pm.GetEntities(Of Order)(query, QueryStrategy.DataSourceOnly)
MessageBox.Show(String.Format("Rows retrieved = {0}" + ControlChars.Lf + "Query = {1}", _ orders.Count.ToString(), GetSqlStatement(query))) End Sub
Private Function GetSqlStatement(ByVal query As RdbQuery) As String Dim key As RdbKey = CType(PersistenceManager.DefaultManager.GetDataSourceKey(query.EntityType), RdbKey) Dim aFormatter As New RdbQuerySqlFormatter(key.AdoHelper) Return aFormatter.BuildSqlSelect(query).Sql End Function

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceIdentityInsertException
member.summary: Exception thrown when an "identity insert" operation fails and the flag is on.
member.remarks: If you are using the DevForce-provided stored procedure to perform inserts to tables having identity columns (available with SQL Server 2005 only), the insert operation is performed as a batch rather than with separate insert statements. If any row in the batch fails, the entire insert operation fails, and the PersistenceIdentityInsertException identifies this condition.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.ReadOnlyEntityList`1
member.summary: A read-only usually managed by an .
member.remarks:
A ReadOnlyEntityList is a "live" list managed by an . You cannot directly add or remove items in the list, nor clear the list, since the EntityListManager is responsible for managing the contents of the list.
A ReadOnlyEntityList is returned by the method, which is used by the child properties of an Entity auto-generated by the DevForce Object Mapping Tool. This means that child relational properties (e.g., Order.OrderDetails) will return a ReadOnlyEntityList.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntitySubquery
member.summary: The mechanism through which one query can reference the results of another query to form a join operation in the DevForce Object Query Language.
member.remarks:
An EntitySubquery is a type of , but unlike an EntityQuery an EntitySubquery is always related to another query via an . You use EntitySubquery in place of a SQL join to add query criteria for attributes on related objects.
Like an EntityQuery, an EntitySubquery may contain any number of 's and nested subqueries.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntitySet
member.summary: A serializable collection of Entities that can be retrieved from a PersistenceManager.
member.remarks:
An EntitySet is retrieved from a via the method; it can then be serialized and stored. The EntitySet can be restored by deserializing the contents and calling either the or methods.
The and methods of the PersistenceManager class provide additional serialization and deserialization capabilities. You can use EntitySet directly if you prefer additional control over this processing.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntitySet.#ctor(IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the EntitySet class.
member.remarks: Use this constructor to create an EntitySet for all items in the cache.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntitySet.#ctor(IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager,System.Collections.IEnumerable)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the EntitySet class using the list of entities specified.
member.remarks:
Use this constructor to create an EntitySet for only the items passed in the parameter.
If any temporary Ids have been assigned to entities in the list provided, all related entities which reference the temporary Id must also be included. For example, if an Order has been assigned a temporary Id of -1, the Order and all its OrderDetails must be included in the list, not only the Order or only the OrderDetails.
member.exception: Thrown if temporary Id references cannot be resolved

member.remarks: The EntitySet is serialized to the file in binary format. The user must have write permissions to the directory, and if the file exists it will be overwritten.

member.summary: Static (Shared in Visual Basic) method which creates and loads an EntitySet from the file specified.
member.returns: An EntitySet

Use Load to de-serialize an EntitySet which was previously saved to a file.
Note that this method does not merge the EntitySet into a . Call or for this. Instead of performing the Load and merge/restore as separate steps, you can instead use PersistenceManager.RestoreEntitySet(fileName) to accomplish the same thing.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.IPersistenceLoginManager
member.summary: Interface for server-side user authentication.
member.remarks:
You must implement the IPersistenceLoginManager interface in order to use the feature. The assembly containing the implementation must also be specified in a element in the IdeaBlade.ibconfig.
Note that if IPersistenceLoginManager has been implemented, a call must be made to validate the user before any other PersistenceManager actions may be performed.
Implementation of this interface is optional. If not implemented do not call to perform user validation. When this interface is not implemented the will implicitly perform a Login with null credentials, and use the returned for a non-authenticated "Default" user for all further communications from the client.

example.code:
' Sample showing Login, and implementation of IPersistenceLoginManager
' Create a PM - this will also do an implicit Connect(). Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager
' create a LoginCredential Dim userName As String = "demo" Dim password As String = "demo" Dim domain As String = "Earth" Dim credential As New LoginCredential(userName, password, domain)
MessageBox.Show(("Current user: " + System.Threading.Thread.CurrentPrincipal.Identity.Name))
Try ' "Login" to PersistenceServer Dim bundle As SessionBundle = pm.Login(credential)
' note change in current principal MessageBox.Show(("Current user: " + System.Threading.Thread.CurrentPrincipal.Identity.Name)) Catch le As LoginException MessageBox.Show(le.Message) Catch pse As PersistenceServerException MessageBox.Show("Login failed: " + pse.Message) Catch ex As Exception MessageBox.Show(ex.Message) End Try
'..... Retrieve data, etc.
' Now logout pm.Logout()
<Serializable()> _ Public Class LoginManager : Implements IPersistenceLoginManager
Public Sub New() End Sub
Public Function Login(ByVal pCredential As ILoginCredential, ByVal pManager As PersistenceManager) As IPrincipal _ Implements IPersistenceLoginManager.Login ' note that Login runs on server-side -- this will return false Dim isClient As Boolean = pManager.IsClient
' You would normally validate the credentials, eg against a database, and then ' build and return an object implementing IPrincipal. If pCredential.Domain <> "Earth" Then Throw New LoginException(LoginExceptionType.InvalidUserName, pCredential.Domain, pCredential.UserName) End If
' We'll just return a GenericPrincipal Dim identity As New GenericIdentity(pCredential.UserName) Return New GenericPrincipal(identity, New [String]() {"user"}) End Function End Class

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.IPersistenceLoginManager.Login(IdeaBlade.Persistence.ILoginCredential,IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager)
member.summary: Validate user credentials and return an IPrinicipal.

remarks.para: The returned here is wrapped into a before returning to the client-side code which called .
Implementors should throw a if the credentials passed fail validation.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.DataSourceResolver
member.summary: Used by the framework to manage and resolve data source keys.
member.remarks:
If you use the to call static server-based methods, those methods will receive a DataSourceResolver as a parameter. You can use the DataSourceResolver to access data source key information, and to obtain an .
There is one DataSourceResolver for each extension name used.

example.code:
' Example of a static server method receiving a DataSourceResolver. <AllowRpc()> _ Public Shared Function GetNumberOfOrders(ByVal pPrincipal As IPrincipal, ByVal pResolver As DataSourceResolver, ByVal ParamArray pArgs() As [Object]) As [Object] ' Use the DataSourceResolver to determine key and AdoHelper. Dim aRdbKey As RdbKey = pResolver.GetDataSourceKey(GetType(Order)) Dim aAdoHelper As AdoHelper = aRdbKey.AdoHelper
' Use the AdoHelper to build connection and command objects. Dim connection As IDbConnection = aAdoHelper.CreateConnection(True) Dim val As [Object] = Nothing Dim sqlText As [String] = "select count(*) from OrderSummary"
Using connection Dim command As IDbCommand = aAdoHelper.CreateDbCommand(connection) Command.CommandText = sqlText Command.CommandType = CommandType.Text val = Command.ExecuteScalar() End Using Return val End Function

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.Entity
member.summary: Abstract (MustInherit in Visual Basic) base class for all persistable business objects used within DevForce.
member.remarks:
Instances of Entity are not created directly; instead, every persistable business object type inherits from Entity.
Entity objects are managed and cached by a . You'll use a PersistenceManager to create, retrieve and save your entities. The PersistenceManager will also handle serialization and remoting of entities.
When working with business objects, you will generally focus on creating additional properties to support business logic and rules; basic properties are auto-generated for you by the IdeaBlade DevForce Object Mapping Tool when business objects are designed. You'll modify and delete entities using both auto-generated and custom properties on the business object.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.Entity.#ctor(System.Data.DataRowBuilder)
member.summary: For internal use only.
member.remarks:
This method is not intended to be used directly from your code, it is used internally by the framework. Entities cannot be constructed using this constructor.
Use the Create method stub generated for you in derived classes by the IdeaBlade DevForce Object Mapping Tool to construct business objects.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.Entity.ForcePropertyChanged(System.ComponentModel.PropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Forces a PropertyChanged event to be fired.
member.remarks:
An Empty value or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) for the propertyName parameter of PropertyChangedEventArgs indicates that all of the properties have changed, causing the .NET framework to also fire a ListChangedEventArgs.ListChangedType of "Reset" if the event propagates to a list that supports the ListChanged event.
Passing a null value to this method will insure that a valid (dynamically created) property name is passed on to any listeners.
This method should only be needed in situations where changes to calculated fields or other properties not backed by an must be made known.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.Entity.GetQuery
member.summary: Constructs an that can be used to requery this entity.
member.returns: A new
member.remarks:
The base implementation of this method returns an . This method can be overridden as needed in derived classes.
An EntityQuery built for an Entity backed by a stored procedure or web service method cannot be used to query the data source, since specialized implementations of IEntityQuery are required for these data sources.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.Entity.Undo
member.summary: Undo any changes to the entity.
member.remarks: Rejects any changes made to the Entity since the last save operation. This will also remove the Entity from the PersistenceManager if it was an 'added' object.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.Entity.AddToManager
member.summary: Adds a newly created entity to the .
member.remarks: There is no difference between AddToManager and . Use either method to add a business object created by the method to the PersistenceManager cache. The object must have a "detached" , and if is set must conform to all constraints.

example.code:
' Sample showing creation of a new entity via CreateEntity, and ' adding to the PersistenceManager cache.
Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager ' Retrieve an order Dim order As Order = pm.GetEntity(Of Order)(New PrimaryKey(GetType(Order), 10250)) ' Retrieve a product Dim product As Product = pm.GetEntity(Of Product)(New PrimaryKey(GetType(Product), 1))
' Create an OrderDetail Dim dtl As OrderDetail = pm.CreateEntity(Of OrderDetail)() ' Assign key fields dtl.Order = order dtl.Product = product
' Add the OrderDetail to the PersistenceManager cache DebugFns.WriteLine("row state before add = " + dtl.RowState.ToString()) dtl.AddToManager() DebugFns.WriteLine("row state after add = " + dtl.RowState.ToString())

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.Entity.RemoveFromManager
member.summary: Removes the entity from the PersistenceManager cache.
member.remarks:
The Entity will be in a "detached" state after the remove. RemoveFromManager and can be used interchangeably. Calling RemoveFromManager also clears the PersistenceManager's .
This does not delete the object from the backend server. To delete an entity, use the method.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.Entity.SaveSecurityCheck(System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal)
member.summary: Override to perform a server-side security check during PersistenceManager. processing.
member.remarks: If returns true, the SaveSecurityCheck method is called during save processing prior to saving to the backend data source. If a security check for an entity fails, you should throw an exception to stop further save processing. Any type of pre-save processing can be done in this method, but will not participate in the save transaction if a transactional save was requested.

example.code:
' Sample showing overrides to SaveSecurityEnabled and SaveSecurityCheck within a Customer class Public Class Customer : Inherits CustomerDataRow '.... Public Overrides ReadOnly Property SaveSecurityEnabled() As Boolean Get Return True End Get End Property
Public Overrides Sub SaveSecurityCheck(pPrincipal As IPrincipal) If Not pPrincipal.IsInRole("BigWig") Then Throw New PersistenceSecurityException("User lacks sufficient privileges to save this object.") End If End Sub End Class

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.Entity.QuerySecurityCheck(System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal,IdeaBlade.Persistence.IEntityQuery)
member.summary: Override to perform a server-side security check prior to execution of an .
member.remarks: If returns true, the QuerySecurityCheck method is called prior to execution of an whose is of this subtype. If a security check for the query fails, you should throw an exception to stop the query from executing.

example.code:
' Sample showing overrides to QuerySecurityEnabled and QuerySecurityCheck within a Customer class Public Class Customer : Inherits CustomerDataRow '.... Public Overrides ReadOnly Property QuerySecurityEnabled() As Boolean Get Return True End Get End Property
Public Overrides Sub QuerySecurityCheck(ByVal pPrincipal As IPrincipal, ByVal pQuery As IEntityQuery) Dim aQuery As RdbQuery = CType(pQuery, RdbQuery) If aQuery.ContainsSubquery AndAlso Not pPrincipal.IsInRole("PatientPerson") Then Throw New PersistenceSecurityException("Subqueries on customer are too time-consuming for you.") End If End Sub End Class

member.summary: Whether if the most recent change to the entity occured after the entity was fully constructed this is needed because the ColumnChanged events occur before a rowstate change but the RowChanged event occurs after. This means that the RowChanged event cannot tell if the change that it is processing occured before or after the RowState change.

member.name: P:IdeaBlade.Persistence.Entity.IsNullEntity
member.summary: Returns whether the current instance is a null entity.
member.remarks: The PersistenceManager.GetEntity method will return a null entity when the requested object cannot be found.

example.code: ' Sample showing IsNullEntity check. Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager ' Try to retrieve order #1 Dim order As Order = pm.GetEntity(Of Order)(New PrimaryKey(GetType(Order), 1)) If order.IsNullEntity Then MessageBox.Show("Order 1 not found.") Else MessageBox.Show("Order 1 date is " + order.OrderDate.Value.ToShortDateString()) End If

member.name: P:IdeaBlade.Persistence.Entity.NullEntity
member.summary: The null instance of this entity type.
member.remarks:
Every entity type has a default 'null' entity, which can be overridden using . A null entity has all of the characteristics of a real entity except that it is immutable and is never persisted.
You may use NullEntity and interchangeably.

example.code: ' Sample showing override of UpdateNullEntity in the Customer entity ' to provide NullEntity customization. Public Class Customer : Inherits CustomerDataRow '.... ' Provide custom implementation for NullEntity Protected Overrides Sub UpdateNullEntity() Me.CompanyName = "{N/A}" End Sub End Class

member.name: P:IdeaBlade.Persistence.SaveResult.EntitiesWithErrors
member.summary: A list of any objects that failed during the save process.
member.remarks:
Each of these entities has a RowError property that contains the actual error encountered during the save of that entity.
Note that the length of the list of errors returned in the SaveResult will be determined by the transactional nature of the save being attempted. In a transactional save, the first failure causes a rollback of the entire operation and only this first error will be returned in the SaveResult. In a nontransactional save all of the errors encountered during the save will be returned.

member.summary: An enum used to determine how to retrieve entities from the cache.

member.name: F:IdeaBlade.Persistence.CacheSearchStrategy.DefaultIndexing

member.name: F:IdeaBlade.Persistence.CacheSearchStrategy.DynamicIndexing
member.summary: Retrieve entities from the cache using a dynamically constructed set of indexes.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.MergeStrategy
member.summary: An enum used when retrieving or restoring entities to determine how to merge results back into the cache.
member.remarks:
Use the MergeStrategy to determine merge behavior when a cached entity and its corresponding data source entity are no longer in sync.
A cached entity is considered current if its DataRowVersion.Orginal matches the incoming entity's current state. If there is a mismatch, the cached version is considered obsolete, since the incoming entity has been modified by some other means since the entity was first fetched.
A MergeStrategy is used when fetching entities from a data source, either through a Get or Refetch; when restoring entities from an ; and when doing an Import from another PersistenceManager.
All strategies (except NotApplicable) replace an unmodified cached entity completely.
You can find a complete discussion of merge strategies in the DevForce Developer's Guide.

member.name: F:IdeaBlade.Persistence.MergeStrategy.NotApplicable
member.summary: No merge action applies because there is no data source data. This merge strategy must be used and may only be used with the CacheOnly fetch strategy.

member.name: F:IdeaBlade.Persistence.MergeStrategy.OverwriteChanges
member.summary: Overwrites the cached entity with incoming data and uses the RowState of the incoming entity (will be Unchanged if the incoming entity is from the data source).

member.name: F:IdeaBlade.Persistence.MergeStrategy.PreserveChanges
member.summary: Preserves (does not overwrite) any existing entities that have been changed (modified, added or deleted).

member.name: F:IdeaBlade.Persistence.MergeStrategy.PreserveChangesUnlessOriginalObsolete
member.summary: Preserves the persistent state of the cached entity if the entity is current. Overwrites an entity if it is obsolete and gives it the RowState of the incoming entity (will be Unchanged if the incoming entity is from the data source).

member.name: F:IdeaBlade.Persistence.MergeStrategy.PreserveChangesUpdateOriginal
member.summary: Preserves the persistent state of the cached entity whether it is current or not. Overwrites the Original version of the entity if obsolete.

remarks.para: DTC may only be used in the Enterprise versions of DevForce.
When DTC is used, both the transaction isolation level and timeout values may be specified.

When DTC is not used, the transaction isolation level may be specified, however the timeout value is ignored. If you are performing a transactional query, you can use the property to specify a timeout value.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.SchemaInitializationMode
member.summary: An enum used when determining the schema for an .
member.remarks:
The SchemaInitializationMode is used by the framework in ascertaining the runtime data type and corresponding data transform for columns in an .
SchemaInitializationMode defaults to FromMap in entities generated by the DevForce Object Mapping Tool.
See the DevForce Developer's Guide for more information on data transforms and mapping interceptors.

member.name: F:IdeaBlade.Persistence.SchemaInitializationMode.FromMap
member.summary: An Entity's schema is determined solely by the design time definition as generated by the Object Mapping tool. (Default)

member.name: F:IdeaBlade.Persistence.SchemaInitializationMode.FromMapWithDiscovery
member.summary: An Entity's schema is determined primarily by the design time definition as generated by the Object Mapping tool. However if additional fields are discovered at runtime by actually querying the datasource these will be added to the schema as well. This option will be most often used in conjunction with user defined fields. This will require the datasource to be connected on the first reference to each entity type so marked.

member.name: F:IdeaBlade.Persistence.SchemaInitializationMode.FromDataSource
member.summary: An Entity's schema is determined solely by run time discovery via a query to the datasource. This will require the datasource to be connected on the first reference to each entity type so marked.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.DefaultDataSourceKeyResolver
member.summary: Default implementation of the interface.
member.remarks: The DefaultDataSourceKeyResolver is used for all data source key name resolution unless a custom implementation of is found in the list in IdeaBlade.ibconfig.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.IDataSourceKeyResolver
member.summary: Interface used to resolve the data source key which will be used to connect to an 's data source.
member.remarks:
The is used by default to determine the key and connection information to be used when accessing the data source. To override this behavior implement a custom IDataSourceKeyResolver and add its assembly name to the list in IdeaBlade.ibconfig. If a custom IDataSourceKeyResolver is found, a single instance of the class will be created for the , and called for all data source key resolution.
If using a custom IDataSourceKeyResolver you will not need to place data source key information in your IdeaBlade.ibconfig.

example.code:
' Sample custom implementation of IDataSourceKeyResolver.
<Serializable()> _ Public Class DynamicDataSourceKeyResolver : Implements IDataSourceKeyResolver
' This class will process keys named "Dynamic" - other key names ' are handled by the default resolver. ' Note the rdbKeys created here are not defined in IdeaBlade.ibconfig.
' Also note that GetKey will be called once on both the client and the server.
Public Function GetKey(ByVal pKeyName As String, ByVal pKeyExtension As String) As IDataSourceKey Implements IDataSourceKeyResolver.GetKey
Dim aKey As IDataSourceKey
If pKeyName <> "Dynamic" Then Return Nothing ' Allow default resolution of key. End If ' Switch database server based on time of day. If DateTime.UtcNow.Hour < 12 Then aKey = New RdbKey(pKeyName, "Provider=SQLOLEDB.1;Integrated Security=SSPI;Initial Catalog=IdeaBladeTutorial;Data Source=SF-Server") Else aKey = New RdbKey(pKeyName, "Provider=SQLOLEDB.1;Integrated Security=SSPI;Initial Catalog=IdeaBladeTutorial;Data Source=NY-Server") End If
Return aKey End Function End Class

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.IDataSourceKeyResolver.GetKey(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the for a given key name and extension.
member.returns: A data source key or null if default key resolution is desired
member.remarks:
If a null key is returned the will attempt to resolve the key.
GetKey will be called once per keyName and keyExtension on both the client and server. If you need to secure your client connection information you may want to implement separate versions of this class on the client and server tiers, possibly using different probeAssemblyName lists in the client and server versions of IdeaBlade.ibconfig.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.DefaultDataSourceKeyResolver.GetKey(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the for a given key name and extension.
member.returns: Concrete data source key
member.remarks:
GetKey searches the keys specified in IdeaBlade.ibconfig for the first key matching the name and extension provided. If an extension is provided, key name matching is first done for the "keyName_ext" pattern; if not found then the "keyName_ext_*" pattern is used; and finally if still not found the search is for the keyName only.
If an extension is not provided (either null or empty string) then only the keyName lookup is done.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.QueryCache
member.summary: A list of queries that can be satisfied without having to go out to an external data source.
member.remarks: The QueryCache is managed by the and is used within the framework to determine which queries can be executed against cache only. Developers don't usually need to interact with the QueryCache, but you do have several means of controlling its contents. Use to access the cache. Use to control whether a query will be cached. You will not usually need to directly add and remove queries from the cache, since PersistenceManager will manage it based on queries executed and entities removed.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.QueryCache.Contains(IdeaBlade.Persistence.IEntityQuery)
member.summary: Determines whether the query cache contains the specified EntityQuery.

member.summary: Clears the query cache.
member.remarks:
This does not remove any Entities from the cache. It simply clears the record of which queries have already been performed.
Clearing the query cache also results in subsequent queries retrieving data from the backend data source instead of cache, because the queries used for cached data are unknown.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.DynamicEntityTypeBuilder.CreateType(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a new dynamic entity type without a primary key whose schema is determined from a query. This feature is only available in certain editions of DevForce.
member.param: A "key" or short name for the DynamicEntity type.
member.exception: Thrown if the dynamic type key name is already defined.

example.code:
' Create a DynamicEntity w/o a primary key, whose structure is determined by the query.
Dim aType As Type = DynamicEntityTypeBuilder.CreateType("Foo", "Default") Dim query As New PassthruRdbQuery(aType, "select FirstName, LastName from Employee") Dim list As EntityList(Of DynamicEntity) = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager.GetEntities(Of DynamicEntity)(query)
For Each anEntity As DynamicEntity In list System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine(String.Format("{1}, {0}", anEntity("FirstName"), anEntity("LastName"))) Next anEntity

For Each anEntity As DynamicEntity In list System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine(String.Format("{0}: {1} {2}", anEntity.PrimaryKey.ToString(), anEntity("FirstName"), anEntity("LastName"))) Next anEntity

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.SaveOptions
member.summary: Options that can be used to control processing.
member.remarks:
Using SaveOptions you can set whether save processing , the of entities to be saved, the of commands sent to the data source, to specify whether to fixup all generated temporary Ids or only those Ids corresponding to entities passed into the SaveChanges method, and the rule.
By default, is true, specify that the UseDTC setting in the IdeaBlade.ibconfig is used, is 1, the is determined by a topological sort based on entity relationships, is set to All, and is .
If using the default setting you should be sure to wrap the SaveChanges call within try/catch logic.

member.summary: A SaveOptions copy constructor.

member.summary: Equivalent to property setter.

member.summary: Used internally by the DevForce framework.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.SaveOptions.GetDefaultPersistenceOrder(IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager)
member.summary: Gets the default persistence order using a topological sort based on entity relationships.

member.name: P:IdeaBlade.Persistence.SaveOptions.IsTransactional
member.summary: Gets or sets whether save processing is transactional.
member.value: true if this instance is transactional; otherwise, false.
member.remarks:
Determines whether to allow any updates to the backend data source in the event that any errors are encountered. If is true, then all changes will be rejected if any update or insert fails. If is false, then only the failing updates or inserts will not be reflected in the data source.
The length of the list of errors returned in the will be determined by the transactional nature of the save being attempted. In a transactional save, the first failure causes a rollback of the entire operation and only this first error will be returned in the SaveResult. In a non-transactional save all of the errors encountered during the save will be returned.
Upon success , or for a non-transactional save in which errors occurred, will have been called.

member.name: P:IdeaBlade.Persistence.SaveOptions.TransactionSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets the transactional behavior for the save.
member.remarks: Defaults to using the UseDTC setting in IdeaBlade.ibconfig.

member.name: P:IdeaBlade.Persistence.SaveOptions.PersistenceOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets the order in which entities should be processed when persisting to a backend data source.
member.exception: Thrown if an entity type is unknown
member.remarks:
Takes and returns a list of types in processing order.
If the data source contains any foreign key constraints or other hierarchical relationships the PersistenceOrder should be set to reflect this. Any entity types that are not specified will be treated as if appearing after the specified types.
Processing of a save operation will be handled internally in the following sequence:
First all deletes for all tables will be processed in the inverse order to that specified by the PersistenceOrder.
Next inserts and updates will be processed in the specified PersistenceOrder.

member.name: P:IdeaBlade.Persistence.SaveOptions.UpdateBatchSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the ADO.NET 2.0 DbDataAdapter value that enables or disables batch processing support, and specifies the number of commands that can be executed in a batch.
member.remarks:
The default value is 1, which means that batch processing is disabled. Use a value of 0 to indicate the largest possible setting for the provider, and a value greater than 1 to indicate the actual batch size wanted.
Note that setting this value has no effect if using an OleDb provider; you must use a native provider if you wish to enable batch processing.

member.name: P:IdeaBlade.Persistence.SaveOptions.ThrowExceptionOnSaveFailure
member.summary: Gets or sets the conditions under which an exception should be thrown if the fails.

member.name: P:IdeaBlade.Persistence.SaveOptions.FixupTempIds
member.summary: Gets or sets the option to fixup all generated temporary Ids or only those Ids corresponding to entities passed into the SaveChanges method.

member.name: P:IdeaBlade.Persistence.SaveOptions.ExcludeFromPostSaveRefetch
member.summary: Gets or sets the types of entities to be excluded from the refetch that is performed after a save.
member.exception: Thrown if an entity type is unknown
member.remarks:
Examples of types of entities to exclude from post-save refetch:
Entities that have changed solely because the creation timeStamp has changed.
User saves a large image entity in addition to other entities in the same transaction. Perhaps those other entities should be re-queried and returned but not the image entity.
User saves a modified Employee. The middle tier (SaveSecurityCheck) generates three Audit objects reflecting the modification. Four objects are returned to the client cache - the Employee and the 3 audit objects. The preferred response would be to re-read the Employee but block the Audit records.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.FixupTempIds

member.summary: Never throw an exception if SaveChanges fails.

member.summary: Returned from a call to uniquely identify a client session.

After , all client and server exchanges are accompanied by this tamper-proof certification. The server typically caches the SessionBundle for performance; however, the cached version is not essential and can be (re)constructed as needed so that load-balanced, multi-server applications can be truly stateless.
Although the SessionBundle is returned from a Login, your application code will rarely, if ever, need to use the SessionBundle directly.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.DynamicEntity
member.summary: Base class for all Dynamic entities.
member.remarks:
A dynamic entity type is used to define a class which inherits from the DevForce but whose schema is not known until runtime. The schema or structure of a dynamic entity type can be set either when it is created by the or when instances of that type are first queried for from the . Dynamic entity type instances reside in the entity cache of a PersistenceManager just like instances of the static entity types. They can be queried, created, modified and deleted. (Persisting data to the backend datasource requires implementation of a custom IAdapterProvider.)
Dynamic entity types can be defined with or without a primary key. Instances of dynamic entity types with a primary key operate almost exactly like regular DevForce entity types, and follow the same merge semantics when the structure of the query matches the type's schema.
Instances of dynamic entity types without a primary key can be queried into the PersistenceManager cache like any other entity type, but because no primary key exists the results cannot be merged with previously retrieved data. Because a merge cannot be performed without a primary key, previously retrieved data for the dynamic entity is discarded each time a query for the type is executed. Because of this behavior, the schema for a dynamic type without a primary key can be changed each time it is queried for.
Currently dynamic entities can be queried for using either a PassthruRdbQuery against a database-backed datasource or from the local cache using an .
To implement query and/or save security of dynamic entities, you must implement the .

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityList`1
member.summary: A strongly-typed holding objects.
member.remarks:
An EntityList is returned by all the generic GetEntities<T> methods in to return strongly-typed lists of entities.
The EntityList has all the benefits of a but can also optionally be used as a "live" or managed list through several means: 1) The method can be used to set a live list of parent or child entities; or 2) for complex filtering capabilities an can be assigned to the property.
The property can also be used independent from other filtering to indicate whether deleted entities should automatically be removed from the list.
An EntityList differs from a in that it supports the and methods, and will not be a "live" list unless a has been attached.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityList`1.#ctor

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from a strongly-typed collection.
member.remarks: Note that if the collection passed is an EntityList or with a assigned, the ListManager will also manage this list. If this behavior is not wanted, call for this list.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityList`1.InitializeRelationConstraint(IdeaBlade.Persistence.Entity,IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityRelation,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a constraint on this list to transform it into a "live" or managed list.
member.param: If true the constraint will be applied to the list immediately
member.remarks:
Initializing a constraint ensures that all of the list elements will be children of the specified parent entity via the indicated.
Constructing an EntityList and calling InitializeRelationConstraint is analogous to calling one of the PersistenceManager GetChildren<T> methods for a parent entity and specifying that a managed list be returned.
An is created to manage this list from the constraint specified.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityList`1.RemoveRelationConstraint

member.summary: Forces an EntityList with a relation constraint to refresh itself.
member.remarks:
A relation constraint is added using the method.
Child entities are re-fetched using the FetchStrategy, then the specified is applied.
member.exception: Thrown if no relation constraints have been added

member.summary: The EntityList is responsible for removal of items that do not belong in the list when the item changes.

member.name: P:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityList`1.ShouldRemoveDeletedEntities
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to remove an entity from this list when the entity is deleted.
member.remarks:
Calling on an Entity does not automatically cause the entity to be removed from a list, unless the ShouldRemoveDeletedEntities flag is on.
If deleted entities are being automatically removed by the list, be sure not to pass the list to a call to have the entities removed from the backend data source; instead place the deleted entities in another array or list if you need to track them for persistence purposes.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager
member.summary: Management class for all high-level retrieval, caching and persistence operations on business objects.
member.remarks:
The PersistenceManager is responsible for communicating with a to retrieve entities from and persist entities to their backend data sources, managing entities in its cache, creating new entities, ensuring entity security, and persisting its cache to local storage to facilitate disconnected access.
A single PersistenceManager can manage entities backed by any number of data sources. It caches objects and queries, both to improve performance and to support offline operation of applications. Entities remain in the cache until the application terminates or they are explicitly removed.
Use and to validate a user's credentials and provide session-level security to the . You'll need to implement to perform this validation. If login security is required, be sure to call Login prior to performing any other PersistenceManager actions.
Use and to explicitly manage connection state to the PersistenceServer. Use the delegate to set up an error handler to catch connection and other PersistenceServer problems. Use to determine whether a data source connection is available.
Use the and methods, or one of their many overloads, to retrieve objects from either the backend data source or the PersistenceManager's cache. Use to create new business objects. Use one of the overloads to persist changed objects to the backend data source.
Use to save cached business objects and the state of the PersistenceManager to the local file system. Use to restore from the saved file. Use to move entities between PersistenceManagers.
Use to begin an in-memory log recording changes to cached objects, and to undo those object changes, or to stop recording.
Note: The PersistenceManager is not thread-safe.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.#ctor

overloads.summary: Initialize a new instance of the PersistenceManager class.

member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the PersistenceManager class and connect to the backend PersistenceServer.
member.remarks:
Equivalent to PersistenceManager(Boolean, String) requesting that a connection to the PersistenceServer be made, and using an empty data source extension string.
Every PersistenceManager (and PersistenceServer) is associated with a data source extension. By default, if an extension is not specified, then an "empty" extension is used. See the "Data Source Keys, DataSourceKeyResolvers, and Data Source Extensions" topic in the Developers Guide for more information on data source extensions.
No connection to data sources is made during PersistenceManager initialization.
A event is fired upon creation.

example.code:
Private Function InitializePM() As Boolean Dim runTimeEnv As String #If Test Then runTimeEnv = "Test" #Else runTimeEnv = "Prod" #End If
' Initialize a PM for the given data source extension, and set up an error handler. Dim pm As New PersistenceManager(False, runTimeEnv) AddHandler pm.PersistenceServerError, AddressOf PersistenceServerErrorHandler
' Explicitly connect to the PersistenceServer now. ' Note that no data source connection is made until entities are accessed. Try pm.Connect() Catch pse As PersistenceServerException MessageBox.Show(pse.Message, "PersistenceServerException") Catch e As Exception MessageBox.Show(e.Message, "Exception") End Try
Return pm.IsConnected End Function
Private Sub PersistenceServerErrorHandler(ByVal pSender As Object, ByVal e As PersistenceServerErrorEventArgs) ' Always a good idea to log all exception info. Dim ex As Exception = e.Exception While Not (ex Is Nothing) TraceFns.WriteLine(ex.ToString()) ex = ex.InnerException End While
MessageBox.Show("Trying to handle error") ' Leave e.Handled = false if the PersistenceServerError should be thrown back to the calling code e.Handled = True ' exception will not be thrown End Sub

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the PersistenceManager class for the specified data source key extension, and optionally connect to the PersistenceServer.
member.param: True if a connection to the PersistenceServer should be made.
The DataSourceKey extension to search for in IdeaBlade.ibconfig.
member.remarks:
You can use the to determine the run-time data source key(s) to be used. Every PersistenceManager (and PersistenceServer) is associated with a data source extension. By default, if an extension is not specified, then an "empty" extension is used. See the "Data Source Keys, DataSourceKeyResolvers, and Data Source Extensions" topic in the Developers Guide for more information on data source extensions. The use of different data source extensions can be especially beneficial as you move your application between development, test and production environments, and for other situations in which the data source to be accessed will be determined at run time. The resolved DataSourceKey(s) must either be specified in the IdeaBlade.ibconfig file or through a custom implementation of .
You can also choose whether a connection to the should be made now. If is true you will not be able to catch any thrown due to connection problems in a handler, since the handler will not yet be set; you should instead wrap the call in a try/catch. If is false then you will need to call the method when you are ready to begin communicating with the PersistenceServer.
No connection to data sources is made during PersistenceManager initialization.
A event is fired upon creation.

example.code:
Private Function InitializePM() As Boolean Dim runTimeEnv As String #If Test Then runTimeEnv = "Test" #Else runTimeEnv = "Prod" #End If
' Initialize a PM for the given data source extension, and set up an error handler. Dim pm As New PersistenceManager(False, runTimeEnv) AddHandler pm.PersistenceServerError, AddressOf PersistenceServerErrorHandler
' Explicitly connect to the PersistenceServer now. ' Note that no data source connection is made until entities are accessed. Try pm.Connect() Catch pse As PersistenceServerException MessageBox.Show(pse.Message, "PersistenceServerException") Catch e As Exception MessageBox.Show(e.Message, "Exception") End Try
Return pm.IsConnected End Function
Private Sub PersistenceServerErrorHandler(ByVal pSender As Object, ByVal e As PersistenceServerErrorEventArgs) ' Always a good idea to log all exception info. Dim ex As Exception = e.Exception While Not (ex Is Nothing) TraceFns.WriteLine(ex.ToString()) ex = ex.InnerException End While
MessageBox.Show("Trying to handle error") ' Leave e.Handled = false if the PersistenceServerError should be thrown back to the calling code e.Handled = True ' exception will not be thrown End Sub

This copy constructor will create a new "empty" (no data) PersistenceManager with the same settings, defaults and connection status as the specified PersistenceManager. The new PersistenceManager will be "logged in" to the PersistenceServer with the credentials already provided in the passed PersistenceManager. See the "Logging In a Second PersistenceManager Based on the Credentials of Another PersistenceManager" topic in the Developers Guide for more information on when and how to use this constructor.
Other than the login credentials and connection state, the settings copied from the source PersistenceManager are , , , and .

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.SaveEntitySet(System.String)

overloads.summary: Stores the state of this PersistenceManager and cached entities to a stream or file.

member.summary: Stores the state of this PersistenceManager and all cached entities to a file system file.
member.param: Name of file to use. Will be overwritten if it exists.
member.remarks: All entities in the PersistenceManager cache will be saved to the file specified. The file will contain the cache and current state in a binary format. The user must have write permissions to the folder, and if the file exists it will be overwritten.

example.code:
Private Sub SampleEntitySetUsage() Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager
' Cache all products. pm.GetEntities(Of Product)() System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine(("cached product rows = " + pm.GetTable(GetType(Product)).Rows.Count.ToString()))
' Save the cache to local storage. pm.SaveEntitySet("c:\temp\entityset.bin")
' Ocassionally-connected users will normally connect, cache all data required, ' then disconnect and work from local cache and/or locally saved cache until they can reconnect. ' In this example, we'll mimic a disconnected login for this user by clearing all cached data ' and then re-loading the cache from local storage. pm.Disconnect() pm.Clear() System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine(("cached product rows after clear = " + pm.GetTable(GetType(Product)).Rows.Count.ToString()))
pm.RestoreEntitySet("c:\temp\entityset.bin") System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine(("cached product rows after restore = " + pm.GetTable(GetType(Product)).Rows.Count.ToString()))
' Let's reconnect and get more data now. pm.Connect() pm.GetEntities(Of Customer)() System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine(("cached customer rows = " + pm.GetTable(GetType(Customer)).Rows.Count.ToString())) End Sub

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.SaveEntitySet(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String)
member.summary: Stores the state of this PersistenceManager and the specified entities to a file system file.

member.remarks: The specified entities and the current state of the PersistenceManager will be saved to the specified file in binary format. The user must have write permissions to the folder, and if the file exists it will be overwritten.
