member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.Login(IdeaBlade.Persistence.ILoginCredential)
member.summary: Used to validate a user's credentials.
member.returns: A SessionBundle identifying the user's session.
member.remarks:
Login may be used to validate a user's credentials and provide more secure communications between client and server tiers. To use this method you must also implement the interface, which will be called by the to perform validation.
The returned contains an and other identifying information, and will be used in all subsequent calls to the PersistenceServer.
If implemented, you must call Login to validate the user after calling and before calling any other PersistenceManager functions. This call does not cause a connection to any backend data source, nor does it maintain an open conversation with the PersistenceServer.
member.exception: PM.Connect() must be called before Login
Login failure

example.code:
' Sample showing Login, and implementation of IPersistenceLoginManager
' Create a PM - this will also do an implicit Connect(). Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager
' create a LoginCredential Dim userName As String = "demo" Dim password As String = "demo" Dim domain As String = "Earth" Dim credential As New LoginCredential(userName, password, domain)
MessageBox.Show(("Current user: " + System.Threading.Thread.CurrentPrincipal.Identity.Name))
Try ' "Login" to PersistenceServer Dim bundle As SessionBundle = pm.Login(credential)
' note change in current principal MessageBox.Show(("Current user: " + System.Threading.Thread.CurrentPrincipal.Identity.Name)) Catch le As LoginException MessageBox.Show(le.Message) Catch pse As PersistenceServerException MessageBox.Show("Login failed: " + pse.Message) Catch ex As Exception MessageBox.Show(ex.Message) End Try
'..... Retrieve data, etc.
' Now logout pm.Logout()
<Serializable()> _ Public Class LoginManager : Implements IPersistenceLoginManager
Public Sub New() End Sub
Public Function Login(ByVal pCredential As ILoginCredential, ByVal pManager As PersistenceManager) As IPrincipal _ Implements IPersistenceLoginManager.Login ' note that Login runs on server-side -- this will return false Dim isClient As Boolean = pManager.IsClient
' You would normally validate the credentials, eg against a database, and then ' build and return an object implementing IPrincipal. If pCredential.Domain <> "Earth" Then Throw New LoginException(LoginExceptionType.InvalidUserName, pCredential.Domain, pCredential.UserName) End If
' We'll just return a GenericPrincipal Dim identity As New GenericIdentity(pCredential.UserName) Return New GenericPrincipal(identity, New [String]() {"user"}) End Function End Class

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.Logout
member.summary: Logs the user off, discarding the current .

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.SaveChanges
member.summary: Persists all changed objects within the PersistenceManager cache to the backend data source using the .
member.returns: A object that contains a boolean indicating the result of the save as well as any errors encountered during the save.
member.remarks:
The length of the list of errors returned in the will be determined by the transactional nature of the save being attempted. In a transactional save, the first failure causes a rollback of the entire operation and only this first error will be returned in the SaveResult. In a non-transactional save all of the errors encountered during the save will be returned.
Upon success , or for a non-transactional save in which errors occurred, will have been called.
A is always returned if no errors occurred during save processing, if processing was cancelled, or if the error was handled by the event handler. If an unhandled error occurred the value of the setting determines if a SaveResult is returned: if is used, a SaveResult will be returned with the set; if is used, a is thrown.
member.exception: Thrown depending on setting.

example.code:
Private Sub SaveSample() Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager
' Retrieve a single Order and its Customer Dim order As Order = pm.GetEntity(Of Order)(New PrimaryKey(GetType(Order), 10275)) Dim cust As Customer = order.Customer
' Change the address in both Order and Customer order.ShipAddress = "100 Broadway" cust.Address = "100 Broadway"
' Now save -- using a save list and SaveOptions. Dim changedEntities As New EntityList(Of Entity) changedEntities.Add(order) changedEntities.Add(cust) Dim options As New SaveOptions() options.IsTransactional = True options.ThrowExceptionOnSaveFailure = ThrowExceptionRule.Never
Dim sr As SaveResult = pm.SaveChanges(changedEntities, options) If sr.Ok Then MessageBox.Show("Changes saved to database.") Else Dim errMsg = New System.Text.StringBuilder() If Not (sr.Exception Is Nothing) Then errMsg.AppendFormat("{0}" + ControlChars.Lf, sr.Exception.Message) End If For Each anEntity as Entity In sr.EntitiesWithErrors errMsg.AppendFormat("{0}: {1}" + ControlChars.Lf, anEntity.GetType().Name, anEntity.RowError) Next anEntity MessageBox.Show(errMsg.ToString()) ' Let's reject the failed changes now too to reset the RowState pm.RejectChanges() End If End Sub

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.SaveChanges(IdeaBlade.Persistence.SaveOptions)
member.summary: Persists all changed objects within the PersistenceManager cache to the backend data source using the specified.
member.returns: A object that contains a boolean indicating the result of the save as well as any errors encountered during the save.
member.remarks:
Persists all additions, modifications and deletions within the PersistenceManager cache to the backend data source.
The length of the list of errors returned in the will be determined by the transactional nature of the save being attempted. In a transactional save, the first failure causes a rollback of the entire operation and only this first error will be returned in the SaveResult. In a non-transactional save all of the errors encountered during the save will be returned.
Upon success , or for a non-transactional save in which errors occurred, will have been called.
A is always returned if no errors occurred during save processing, if processing was cancelled, or if the error was handled by the event handler. If an unhandled error occurred the value of the setting determines if a SaveResult is returned: if is used, a SaveResult will be returned with the set; if is used, a is thrown.
member.exception: Thrown depending on setting.

example.code:
Private Sub SaveSample() Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager
' Retrieve a single Order and its Customer Dim order As Order = pm.GetEntity(Of Order)(New PrimaryKey(GetType(Order), 10275)) Dim cust As Customer = order.Customer
' Change the address in both Order and Customer order.ShipAddress = "100 Broadway" cust.Address = "100 Broadway"
' Now save -- using a save list and SaveOptions. Dim changedEntities As New EntityList(Of Entity) changedEntities.Add(order) changedEntities.Add(cust) Dim options As New SaveOptions() options.IsTransactional = True options.ThrowExceptionOnSaveFailure = ThrowExceptionRule.Never
Dim sr As SaveResult = pm.SaveChanges(changedEntities, options) If sr.Ok Then MessageBox.Show("Changes saved to database.") Else Dim errMsg = New System.Text.StringBuilder() If Not (sr.Exception Is Nothing) Then errMsg.AppendFormat("{0}" + ControlChars.Lf, sr.Exception.Message) End If For Each anEntity as Entity In sr.EntitiesWithErrors errMsg.AppendFormat("{0}: {1}" + ControlChars.Lf, anEntity.GetType().Name, anEntity.RowError) Next anEntity MessageBox.Show(errMsg.ToString()) ' Let's reject the failed changes now too to reset the RowState pm.RejectChanges() End If End Sub

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.SaveChanges(System.Collections.IEnumerable)
member.summary: Persists one or more selected Entities within the PersistenceManager cache to the backend data source using the .
member.param: List of objects to be persisted
member.returns: A SaveResult object that contains a boolean indicating the result of the save as well as any errors encountered during the save.
member.remarks:
The length of the list of errors returned in the will be determined by the transactional nature of the save being attempted. In a transactional save, the first failure causes a rollback of the entire operation and only this first error will be returned in the SaveResult. In a non-transactional save all of the errors encountered during the save will be returned.
Upon success DataSet.AcceptChanges, or DataRow.AcceptChanges for a non-transactional save in which errors occurred, will have been called.
A is always returned if no errors occurred during save processing, if processing was cancelled, or if the error was handled by the event handler. If an unhandled error occurred the value of the setting determines if a SaveResult is returned: if is used, a SaveResult will be returned with the set; if is used, a is thrown.
If you are saving only a single entity, an easy way of calling this method is to create a new one-item array, similar to the following example: C#: pm.SaveChanges(new Employee[] { myEmployee }); VB: pm.SaveChanges(New Employee() {myEmployee})
member.exception: Thrown depending on setting.

example.code:
Private Sub SaveSample() Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager
' Retrieve a single Order and its Customer Dim order As Order = pm.GetEntity(Of Order)(New PrimaryKey(GetType(Order), 10275)) Dim cust As Customer = order.Customer
' Change the address in both Order and Customer order.ShipAddress = "100 Broadway" cust.Address = "100 Broadway"
' Now save -- using a save list and SaveOptions. Dim changedEntities As New EntityList(Of Entity) changedEntities.Add(order) changedEntities.Add(cust) Dim options As New SaveOptions() options.IsTransactional = True options.ThrowExceptionOnSaveFailure = ThrowExceptionRule.Never
Dim sr As SaveResult = pm.SaveChanges(changedEntities, options) If sr.Ok Then MessageBox.Show("Changes saved to database.") Else Dim errMsg = New System.Text.StringBuilder() If Not (sr.Exception Is Nothing) Then errMsg.AppendFormat("{0}" + ControlChars.Lf, sr.Exception.Message) End If For Each anEntity as Entity In sr.EntitiesWithErrors errMsg.AppendFormat("{0}: {1}" + ControlChars.Lf, anEntity.GetType().Name, anEntity.RowError) Next anEntity MessageBox.Show(errMsg.ToString()) ' Let's reject the failed changes now too to reset the RowState pm.RejectChanges() End If End Sub

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.RejectChanges
member.summary: Rolls back all Entity changes since the cache was created or the last call was made.
member.remarks: This is functionally equivalent to .

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.HasChanges
member.summary: Determines whether the PersistenceManager cache has any changes that have not yet been persisted to the backend data source.
member.returns: Whether the PersistenceManager has any pending changes.
member.remarks:
Use to save changes in cached data to the backend data source.
This is functionally equivalent to .

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.Clear
member.summary: Resets the PersistenceManager to its initial "newed" state.
member.remarks: This will clear all cached data and queries, reset IdGenerators, and clear checkpoints. Any pending changes will be lost.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.GetEntity(IdeaBlade.Persistence.PrimaryKey)

overloads.summary:
Retrieve a single . If the query retrieves more than one entity, only the first is returned.
There are two main ways of retrieving an entity: 1) using an , or 2) using a . Each of these also allows for a to be specified or to default. Each also has generic and non-generic versions.

member.summary: Retrieve a single Entity based on its primary key.
member.param: PrimaryKey of the Entity to retrieve
member.returns: The requested or a of the appropriate type.
member.remarks: The is used.
member.exception: DataSource fetch strategies are not allowed when disconnected
Thrown for errors not handled by a handler

example.code:
' Sample GetEntity calls Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager
Dim order1, order2 As Order Dim cust1, cust2 As Customer
' (1) Retrieve a business object using a query. Dim qry As New RdbQuery(GetType(Order), Order.IdEntityColumn, EntityQueryOp.EQ, 10248) ' Use the DefaultQueryStrategy order1 = pm.GetEntity(Of Order)(qry) ' Specify the QueryStrategy order2 = pm.GetEntity(Of Order)(qry, QueryStrategy.DataSourceOnly)
' (2) Retrieve a business object based on its primary key Dim pk As New PrimaryKey(GetType(Customer), 1) ' Use the DefaultQueryStrategy cust1 = pm.GetEntity(Of Customer)(pk) 'Specify the QueryStrategy cust2 = pm.GetEntity(Of Customer)(pk, QueryStrategy.CacheOnly)

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.GetEntities(IdeaBlade.Persistence.PrimaryKey[])

overloads.summary:
Retrieves one or more objects. If the query retrieves no rows then an empty array or list is returned.
There are three main ways of retrieving entities:
Using an
Using a list of s
Using the entity type to retrieve all objects of that type
Each of these also allows for a to be specified or to default. Each also has generic and non-generic versions.

member.summary: Retrieves an array of Entities based on an array of PrimaryKeys.
member.param: Primary Keys of Entities to return
member.returns: Array of entities corresponding to the primary keys passed in
member.remarks:
The Entities returned are not guaranteed to be in any specific order nor is there any assurance that the number of entities returned will equal the number of primary keys passed in. It is possible for any given PrimaryKey to not have a corresponding Entity in the database.
Note: The primary keys passed to this method must all be for the same entity type.
The is used.
member.exception: DataSource fetch strategies are not allowed when disconnected
Thrown for errors not handled by a handler

example.code:
' Sample GetEntities calls Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager
Dim orders1, orders2 As EntityList(Of Order) Dim customers1, customers2, customers3 As EntityList(Of Customer) Dim products1, products2 As EntityList(Of Product)
' (1) Retrieve entities based on a query. Dim qry As New RdbQuery(GetType(Order), Order.OrderDateEntityColumn, EntityQueryOp.GE, "1/1/1998")
' Use the DefaultQueryStrategy orders1 = pm.GetEntities(Of Order)(qry) ' Specify the query strategy orders2 = pm.GetEntities(Of Order)(qry)
' (2) Retrieve business objects by entity type. ' Use the DefaultQueryStrategy customers1 = pm.GetEntities(Of Customer)() ' change some entities customers1(0).Phone = "1-800-555-5555" customers1(1).PostalCode = "55555" ' Retrieve entities by rowstate customers2 = pm.GetEntities(Of Customer)(DataRowState.Modified) ' Use a QueryStrategy customers3 = pm.GetEntities(Of Customer)(QueryStrategy.CacheOnly)
' (3) Retrieve business objects by primary key. Dim pk1 As New PrimaryKey(GetType(Product), 1) Dim pk2 As New PrimaryKey(GetType(Product), 2) Dim pk3 As New PrimaryKey(GetType(Product), 3) Dim keyList1 As New PrimaryKeyList(GetType(Product)) keyList1.Add(pk1) keyList1.Add(pk2) Dim keyList2 As New PrimaryKeyList(GetType(Product)) keyList2.Add(pk2) keyList2.Add(pk3)
' Use the DefaultQueryStrategy products1 = pm.GetEntities(Of Product)(keyList1) ' Specify the QueryStrategy products2 = pm.GetEntities(Of Product)(keyList2)

member.returns: A list of related Entities
member.exception: Thrown if pEntityRoots and/or pEntitySpans is null.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.GetEntitiesAsync(IdeaBlade.Persistence.IEntityQuery,IdeaBlade.Persistence.QueryStrategy,System.Object)
member.summary: Asynchronously retrieves Entities into cache based on an EntityQuery and QueryStrategy.
member.param: Query token to identify the query upon completion
member.remarks: You can register a handler for the event to receive notification of when the query completes.
member.exception: GetEntities does not support querying for abstract types
DataSource fetch strategies are not allowed when disconnected

example.code:
' Set a variable to use as a query token. You can use anything, this uses an increasing integer. Private Shared msQueryId As Integer = 0
Private Sub SampleAsynchQuery() Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager
' Set up an event handler AddHandler pm.GetEntitiesCompleted, AddressOf pm_GetEntitiesCompleted
' Build a query and ask PM to run it asynchronously. Dim query As New RdbQuery(GetType(Order), Order.OrderDateEntityColumn, EntityQueryOp.GT, New DateTime(1997, 1, 1)) msQueryId += 1 pm.GetEntitiesAsync(Of Order)(query, QueryStrategy.DataSourceOnly, msQueryId) End Sub
Sub pm_GetEntitiesCompleted(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As GetEntitiesCompletedEventArgs) ' Handle completion of asynchronous queries. If Not (e.Error Is Nothing) Then System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine(e.Error.Message) End If System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine(("queryid = " + e.UserState.ToString())) System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine(("entities retrieved = " + e.Entities.Count.ToString())) End Sub

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.GetEntitiesAsync(IdeaBlade.Persistence.IEntityQuery,IdeaBlade.Persistence.QueryStrategy,System.Object,System.Int32)
member.summary: Asynchronously retrieves Entities into cache based on an EntityQuery and QueryStrategy, repeating query execution at the interval specified. This feature is only available in certain editions of DevForce.
member.param: Query token to identify the query upon completion
Interval in milliseconds to re-execute the query
member.remarks: You can register a handler for the event to receive notification of when the query completes. To turn off re-execution of the query set the to 0.
member.exception: GetEntities does not support querying for abstract types
DataSource fetch strategies are not allowed when disconnected

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.GetChild(IdeaBlade.Persistence.Entity,IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityRelation)
member.summary: Returns a single child Entity given a parent Entity and EntityRelation using the DefaultQueryStrategy.
member.param: The parent Entity whose child entity will be retrieved
The to be used to retrieve the child
member.returns: A child entity
member.remarks: The defining the relationship between the parent and child objects is usually set up using the IdeaBlade DevForce Object Mapping Tool. The Mapping tool will also automatically generate parent and child relation properties for all relationships defined.
member.exception: EntityRelation is not valid for the Entity type
DataSource fetch strategies are not allowed when disconnected
Thrown for errors not handled by a handler

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.BeginCheckpoint
member.summary: Begin a new checkpoint. This feature is only available in certain editions of DevForce.
member.returns: Returns the new current checkpoint depth.
member.remarks:
Use BeginCheckpoint to have the PersistenceManager begin keeping an in-memory record of all future deletions, additions and modifications to Entities in cache. While a checkpoint is active, any changes to an Entity cause a backup copy of the "before" image of the entity to be recorded. A checkpoint is active until either is called to undo changes made since the checkpoint began, or is called to stop recording changes. A call implicitly clears checkpoints also.
Checkpoints can be nested to provide multi-level undo support. Each call to BeginCheckpoint nests the new checkpoint under the current checkpoint, making the new checkpoint the current active checkpoint. will undo the Entity changes made during the current or specified levels of checkpoints, while will undo all Entity changes made since the first checkpoint began.
and are actions logged while a checkpoint is active and do not cause the checkpoint to be cleared or rolled back.
Checkpoints do not provide a means of ensuring fault tolerance within your application or for recording your changes to non-volatile storage. To save the contents of cache to storage you can use the .

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.GetCheckpointDepth
member.summary: Get the depth of the current checkpoint.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.ClearCheckpoints
member.summary: Clears all currently outstanding checkpoints.
member.remarks:
Clearing checkpoints stops all logging of Entity changes and clears any existing log. ClearCheckpoints is automatically called during processing, but can be called any time an "undoable" operation completes successfully but does not immediately need to be persisted to the data source. Clearing checkpoints does not in any way affect the row state or values of cached Entities.
Checkpoints are also cleared when the PersistenceManager is re-initialized with the method.
will return false after checkpoints are cleared.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.RollbackCheckpoint
member.summary: Rollback the current checkpoint.
member.returns: Returns the new current checkpoint depth.
member.remarks:
Rollback allows you to undo all changes made to Entities since the checkpoint began.
To undo Entity changes from multiple levels of nested checkpoints use with the number of levels specified.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.RollbackCheckpoint(System.Int32)
member.summary: Rollback the most recent n checkpoints.
member.returns: Returns the new current checkpoint depth.
member.exception: Thrown if there is no current checkpoint
member.remarks: All Entity changes recorded in the checkpoints will be undone, and the Entities returned to the values and row state in effect at the new current checkpoint.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.RollbackCheckpoints
member.summary: Rollback all of the currently outstanding checkpoints.
member.remarks:
All Entity changes made since checkpointing began will be undone, and the Entities will be returned to the values and row state in effect before checkpointing began.
will return false after all checkpoints are rolled back.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.CreateEntity(System.Type)
member.summary: Create a new entity of the requested type.
member.param: The Entity subtype of the business object to be created
member.returns: A new instance of the specified entity type
member.remarks:
Because business objects derived from do not have publicly available constructors this is the only means of "newing" an Entity. The entity returned has a "detached" ; use or the object's method to add the object to the PersistenceManager cache. If is set you will need to ensure that the entity is valid before adding it to the cache.
You will generally call the CreateEntity method from within the business object's Create method.
member.exception: Bad entity type

example.code:
Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager
' Retrive an order Dim order As Order = pm.GetEntity(Of Order)(New PrimaryKey(GetType(Order), 10275)) ' Retrieve a product Dim product As Product = pm.GetEntity(Of Product)(New PrimaryKey(GetType(Product), 1))
' Create an OrderDetail Dim dtl As OrderDetail = pm.CreateEntity(Of OrderDetail)() ' assign key fields dtl.Order = order dtl.Product = product
' add the OrderDetail to the PersistenceManager cache DebugFns.WriteLine("row state before add = " + dtl.RowState.ToString()) dtl.AddToManager() DebugFns.WriteLine("row state after add = " + dtl.RowState.ToString())

member.remarks: There is no difference between AddEntity and . Use either method to add a business object created by the method to the PersistenceManager cache. The object must have a "detached" , and if is set must conform to all constraints.

example.code:
Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.Connect
member.summary: Connect to the .
member.remarks:
Use Connect and to manage the connection to the PersistenceServer. You should have a handler in place to catch connection failures.
Connect does not connect to any backend data sources. If you need to check a data source connection use .

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnect from the .
member.remarks:
Disconnect marks the connection to the PersistenceServer as closed. Once disconnected, all further queries will be fulfilled using only cached entities, and any call will fail. Note that a is returned for any requested object not found in cache.
Disconnect does not explicitly close data source connections.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.InvokeServerMethod(IdeaBlade.Persistence.ServerRpcDelegate,System.Object[])
member.summary: Invokes the specified static (Shared in Visual Basic) method for execution on the server. This feature is only available in certain editions of DevForce.
member.param: Arguments to be passed to method
member.remarks:
The method called must be marked with the and correspond to the signature.
InvokeServerMethod enables a client-side caller to invoke an arbitrary static method on the server. The method can return any kind of serializable object.
member.exception: Invalid ServerRpcDelegate provided

example.code:
' Sample showing invocation of server method Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager Dim orderId As Integer = 10250 Dim mailSent As Boolean = CBool(pm.InvokeServerMethod(Order.EmailOrderInfo, orderId))
' sample method defined in Order class Public Class Order : Inherits OrderDataRow '... Public Shared<AllowRpc()> _ Function EmailOrderInfo(pPrincipal As IPrincipal, pResolver As DataSourceResolver, ParamArray pArgs() As [Object]) As [Object] Dim orderId As Integer = Convert.ToInt32(pArgs(0))
' build and send an email message Dim from As String = "sales@mycompany.com" Dim [to] As String = "customer@yourcompany.com" Dim msg As New System.Net.Mail.MailMessage(from, [to])
msg.Subject = "Order Information" msg.Body = String.Format("Order id = {0} has been shipped", orderId)
Dim client As New System.Net.Mail.SmtpClient("localhost") Try client.Send(msg) Catch e As Exception TraceFns.WriteLine(e.Message) Return False End Try Return True End Function End Class

' Sample showing invocation of server method Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager Dim orderId As Integer = 10250 Dim mailSent As Boolean = CBool(pm.InvokeServerMethod(Order.EmailOrderInfo, orderId))

' build and send an email message Dim from As String = "sales@mycompany.com" Dim [to] As String = "customer@yourcompany.com" Dim msg As New System.Net.Mail.MailMessage(from, [to])
msg.Subject = "Order Information" msg.Body = String.Format("Order id = {0} has been shipped", orderId)

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.InvokeServerMethodAsync(IdeaBlade.Persistence.ServerRpcPersistenceDelegate,System.Object,System.Object[])
member.summary: Asynchronously invokes the specified static (Shared in Visual Basic) method for execution on the server. This feature is only available in certain editions of DevForce.
member.param: Arguments to be passed to method
member.remarks:
The method called must be marked with the and correspond to the signature.
InvokeServerMethodAsync enables a client-side caller to invoke an arbitrary static method on the server using an asynchronous call. The data returned from the server method will be available in the passed to the event. The server method is called once only. An outstanding request can be canceled using the method.
Note that this request is run on a separate client thread. That thread will block until the server request completes or is canceled.
Asynchronous RPC methods are available to DevForce Enterprise license holders only.

UserState token must be unique for the client

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.RegisterCallback(IdeaBlade.Persistence.ServerNotifyDelegate,IdeaBlade.Persistence.ClientNotifyDelegate,System.Object,System.Object[])
member.summary: Register a client subscription to a server "push" method. This feature is only available in certain editions of DevForce.
member.param: Optional arguments which can be passed to server code
member.remarks: Use RegisterCallback to register a client for messages or data "pushed" from the server. The indicates the method on the server which performs processing which the client wants to "subscribe" to. The indicates the client-side method which will be called whenever the server method pushes data. The should be used to identify the client request. It does not have to be unique acrosss all clients, but it must be unique for all requests from a single client. The can be used to pass argument data from the client through to the server. The server code can query for these arguments using the INotificationManager.GetSubscribers method.
member.exception: Thrown if the ServerNotifyDelegate is not a static method
Thrown if called from a server-side PersistenceManager
Thrown if not using WCF for communication with the BOS
Thrown if the token has already been used to register a callback from this client
Thrown when unable to communicate with the NotificationService or not authorized

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.MergeSourceRows(IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityTable,IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityTable,IdeaBlade.Persistence.MergeStrategy,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Locates all of the rows that are in the source table but are not in the current cache or are in the cache but are marked unchanged. Note that deleted rows in the targetTable are not located by the find operation
member.remarks: This merge is used both to merge data from a datasource into cache, and to merge entity set data. The entity set data can contain added/modified/deleted rows, and the rowstate must be preserved. Note that DataTable.CreateDataReader ignores deleted rows, so the DataTable.Load() can't be used. DataTable.LoadDataRow() does not set the rowstate for deleted rows - because of this we do an ugly row.Delete following the LoadDataRow for deleted source rows. Addendum: was using Upsert, which incorrectly flagged new Unmodified rows as Added - now using OverwriteChanges and really ugly FixupMergeRowState method if row state needs to be preserved. DataTable.Merge() leaves previously modified/added/deleted rows in a modified state after merge.

member.name: E:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.Fetching
member.summary: Occurs before the PersistenceManager fetches data from a PersistenceServer.
member.remarks: The event handler can modify the if needed, and set EntityFetchingEventArgs.Cancel to cancel the fetch. If a fetch is cancelled, a NullEntity or null entity list will be returned.

example.code:
Private Sub PM_EventSample() Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager ' Setup some handlers. AddHandler pm.Fetching, AddressOf FetchingHandler AddHandler pm.Fetched, AddressOf FetchedHandler AddHandler pm.Saving, AddressOf SavingHandler AddHandler pm.Saved, AddressOf SavedHandler
' Now try some fetches and saves. ' Try to retrieve customer - the fetch will be canceled and a NullEntity returned. Dim cust As Customer = pm.GetEntity(Of Customer)(New PrimaryKey(GetType(Customer), 1)) If cust.IsNullEntity Then DebugFns.WriteLine("Customer not fetched") End If
Dim query As New RdbQuery(GetType(Order), Order.CustomerIdEntityColumn, EntityQueryOp.EQ, 1) query.AddSpan(EntityRelations.Employee_Order) Dim orders As EntityList(Of Order) = pm.GetEntities(Of Order)(query) DebugFns.WriteLine(("Order count = " + orders.Count.ToString()))
' Change the first order and its details. Dim anOrder As Order = orders(0) anOrder.Freight = 101 For Each dtl as OrderDetail In anOrder.OrderDetails dtl.Discount = 0.05F Next dtl Dim sr As SaveResult = pm.SaveChanges() End Sub
Sub FetchingHandler(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As EntityFetchingEventArgs) DebugFns.WriteLine("Fetching " + CType(e.Query, Object).ToString())
' Let's arbitrarily cancel the query for this sample... If e.Query.EntityType.Equals(GetType(Customer)) Then e.Cancel = True End If End Sub
Sub FetchedHandler(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As EntityFetchedEventArgs) DebugFns.WriteLine("Fetched " + CType(e.Query, Object).ToString()) For Each anEntity As Entity In e.Entities DebugFns.WriteLine("Fetched - " + anEntity.PrimaryKey.ToString()) Next anEntity End Sub
Sub SavingHandler(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As EntitySavingEventArgs) For Each anEntity As Entity In e.Entities DebugFns.WriteLine("Saving - " + anEntity.PrimaryKey.ToString() + " - " + anEntity.RowState.ToString()) Next anEntity If e.Entities.Count = 0 Then Return End If ' Let's arbitrarily cancel a Customer save for this sample... If GetType(Customer).IsAssignableFrom(e.Entities(0).GetType()) Then e.Cancel = True End If End Sub
Sub SavedHandler(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As EntitySavedEventArgs) For Each anEntity As Entity In e.Entities DebugFns.WriteLine("Saved - " + anEntity.PrimaryKey.ToString()) Next anEntity End Sub

member.name: E:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.Fetched
member.summary: Occurs after the PersistenceManager has fetched data from a PersistenceServer.
member.remarks: The list might be empty if the query was satisfied from cache only. If a span query was used, multiple entity types may be found in the list.

example.code:
Private Sub PM_EventSample() Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager ' Setup some handlers. AddHandler pm.Fetching, AddressOf FetchingHandler AddHandler pm.Fetched, AddressOf FetchedHandler AddHandler pm.Saving, AddressOf SavingHandler AddHandler pm.Saved, AddressOf SavedHandler
' Now try some fetches and saves. ' Try to retrieve customer - the fetch will be canceled and a NullEntity returned. Dim cust As Customer = pm.GetEntity(Of Customer)(New PrimaryKey(GetType(Customer), 1)) If cust.IsNullEntity Then DebugFns.WriteLine("Customer not fetched") End If
Dim query As New RdbQuery(GetType(Order), Order.CustomerIdEntityColumn, EntityQueryOp.EQ, 1) query.AddSpan(EntityRelations.Employee_Order) Dim orders As EntityList(Of Order) = pm.GetEntities(Of Order)(query) DebugFns.WriteLine(("Order count = " + orders.Count.ToString()))
' Change the first order and its details. Dim anOrder As Order = orders(0) anOrder.Freight = 101 For Each dtl as OrderDetail In anOrder.OrderDetails dtl.Discount = 0.05F Next dtl Dim sr As SaveResult = pm.SaveChanges() End Sub
Sub FetchingHandler(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As EntityFetchingEventArgs) DebugFns.WriteLine("Fetching " + CType(e.Query, Object).ToString())
' Let's arbitrarily cancel the query for this sample... If e.Query.EntityType.Equals(GetType(Customer)) Then e.Cancel = True End If End Sub
Sub FetchedHandler(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As EntityFetchedEventArgs) DebugFns.WriteLine("Fetched " + CType(e.Query, Object).ToString()) For Each anEntity As Entity In e.Entities DebugFns.WriteLine("Fetched - " + anEntity.PrimaryKey.ToString()) Next anEntity End Sub
Sub SavingHandler(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As EntitySavingEventArgs) For Each anEntity As Entity In e.Entities DebugFns.WriteLine("Saving - " + anEntity.PrimaryKey.ToString() + " - " + anEntity.RowState.ToString()) Next anEntity If e.Entities.Count = 0 Then Return End If ' Let's arbitrarily cancel a Customer save for this sample... If GetType(Customer).IsAssignableFrom(e.Entities(0).GetType()) Then e.Cancel = True End If End Sub
Sub SavedHandler(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As EntitySavedEventArgs) For Each anEntity As Entity In e.Entities DebugFns.WriteLine("Saved - " + anEntity.PrimaryKey.ToString()) Next anEntity End Sub

AddHandler pm.Fetching, AddressOf FetchingHandler AddHandler pm.Fetched, AddressOf FetchedHandler AddHandler pm.Saving, AddressOf SavingHandler AddHandler pm.Saved, AddressOf SavedHandler
' Now try some fetches and saves. ' Try to retrieve customer - the fetch will be canceled and a NullEntity returned. Dim cust As Customer = pm.GetEntity(Of Customer)(New PrimaryKey(GetType(Customer), 1)) If cust.IsNullEntity Then DebugFns.WriteLine("Customer not fetched") End If
Dim query As New RdbQuery(GetType(Order), Order.CustomerIdEntityColumn, EntityQueryOp.EQ, 1) query.AddSpan(EntityRelations.Employee_Order) Dim orders As EntityList(Of Order) = pm.GetEntities(Of Order)(query) DebugFns.WriteLine(("Order count = " + orders.Count.ToString()))
' Change the first order and its details. Dim anOrder As Order = orders(0) anOrder.Freight = 101 For Each dtl as OrderDetail In anOrder.OrderDetails dtl.Discount = 0.05F Next dtl Dim sr As SaveResult = pm.SaveChanges() End Sub
Sub FetchingHandler(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As EntityFetchingEventArgs) DebugFns.WriteLine("Fetching " + CType(e.Query, Object).ToString())
' Let's arbitrarily cancel the query for this sample... If e.Query.EntityType.Equals(GetType(Customer)) Then e.Cancel = True End If End Sub
Sub FetchedHandler(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As EntityFetchedEventArgs) DebugFns.WriteLine("Fetched " + CType(e.Query, Object).ToString()) For Each anEntity As Entity In e.Entities DebugFns.WriteLine("Fetched - " + anEntity.PrimaryKey.ToString()) Next anEntity End Sub
Sub SavingHandler(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As EntitySavingEventArgs) For Each anEntity As Entity In e.Entities DebugFns.WriteLine("Saving - " + anEntity.PrimaryKey.ToString() + " - " + anEntity.RowState.ToString()) Next anEntity If e.Entities.Count = 0 Then Return End If ' Let's arbitrarily cancel a Customer save for this sample... If GetType(Customer).IsAssignableFrom(e.Entities(0).GetType()) Then e.Cancel = True End If End Sub
Sub SavedHandler(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As EntitySavedEventArgs) For Each anEntity As Entity In e.Entities DebugFns.WriteLine("Saved - " + anEntity.PrimaryKey.ToString()) Next anEntity End Sub

Private Sub PM_EventSample() Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager ' Setup some handlers. AddHandler pm.Fetching, AddressOf FetchingHandler AddHandler pm.Fetched, AddressOf FetchedHandler AddHandler pm.Saving, AddressOf SavingHandler AddHandler pm.Saved, AddressOf SavedHandler
' Now try some fetches and saves. ' Try to retrieve customer - the fetch will be canceled and a NullEntity returned. Dim cust As Customer = pm.GetEntity(Of Customer)(New PrimaryKey(GetType(Customer), 1)) If cust.IsNullEntity Then DebugFns.WriteLine("Customer not fetched") End If
Dim query As New RdbQuery(GetType(Order), Order.CustomerIdEntityColumn, EntityQueryOp.EQ, 1) query.AddSpan(EntityRelations.Employee_Order) Dim orders As EntityList(Of Order) = pm.GetEntities(Of Order)(query) DebugFns.WriteLine(("Order count = " + orders.Count.ToString()))
' Change the first order and its details. Dim anOrder As Order = orders(0) anOrder.Freight = 101 For Each dtl as OrderDetail In anOrder.OrderDetails dtl.Discount = 0.05F Next dtl Dim sr As SaveResult = pm.SaveChanges() End Sub
Sub FetchingHandler(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As EntityFetchingEventArgs) DebugFns.WriteLine("Fetching " + CType(e.Query, Object).ToString())
' Let's arbitrarily cancel the query for this sample... If e.Query.EntityType.Equals(GetType(Customer)) Then e.Cancel = True End If End Sub
Sub FetchedHandler(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As EntityFetchedEventArgs) DebugFns.WriteLine("Fetched " + CType(e.Query, Object).ToString()) For Each anEntity As Entity In e.Entities DebugFns.WriteLine("Fetched - " + anEntity.PrimaryKey.ToString()) Next anEntity End Sub
Sub SavingHandler(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As EntitySavingEventArgs) For Each anEntity As Entity In e.Entities DebugFns.WriteLine("Saving - " + anEntity.PrimaryKey.ToString() + " - " + anEntity.RowState.ToString()) Next anEntity If e.Entities.Count = 0 Then Return End If ' Let's arbitrarily cancel a Customer save for this sample... If GetType(Customer).IsAssignableFrom(e.Entities(0).GetType()) Then e.Cancel = True End If End Sub

member.name: E:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.PersistenceServerError
member.summary: Raised when an error occurs while accessing the PersistenceServer or backend data source.
member.remarks:
The contained within the PersistenceServerErrorEventArgs will indicate the which was requested when the error occurred, and the of the error. Set to true to indicate that the exception should not be re-thrown.
The PersistenceServerError event is raised for any type of exception condition which occurs while accessing the PersistenceServer, including during and processing, fetching data through any of the GetEntity or GetEntities methods, or saving data via SaveChanges.

example.code:
Private Sub SetUpHandler() ' Setup an error handler for PersistenceServerExceptions. ' Note that you cannot use PM.DefaultManager or the default constructor since ' they will attempt to connect to the PersistenceServer, and we want to setup ' an error handler FIRST in order to trap a connection failure. Dim pm As New PersistenceManager(False) AddHandler pm.PersistenceServerError, AddressOf PersistenceServerErrorHandler
' Force an error - assume that remotePersistenceEnabled=true in IdeaBlade.ibconfig, but the ' server has not been started. The connection attempt will fail. Try pm.Connect() ' If the exception was handled we'll get here, otherwise the catch block is entered. Dim emps As EntityList(Of Employee) = pm.GetEntities(Of Employee)() Catch pse As PersistenceServerException MessageBox.Show(pse.Message, "PersistenceServerException") Catch e As Exception MessageBox.Show(e.Message, "Exception") End Try End Sub
Private Sub PersistenceServerErrorHandler(ByVal pSender As Object, ByVal e As PersistenceServerErrorEventArgs) ' Always a good idea to log all exception info. Dim ex As Exception = e.Exception While Not (ex Is Nothing) TraceFns.WriteLine(ex.ToString()) ex = ex.InnerException End While
MessageBox.Show("Trying to handle error") ' Leave e.Handled = false if the PersistenceServerError should be thrown back to the calling code e.Handled = True ' exception will not be thrown End Sub

member.name: P:IdeaBlade.Persistence.PersistenceManager.DefaultManager
member.summary: A static (Shared in Visual Basic) property that gets or sets a default PersistenceManager.
member.remarks:
DefaultManager provides an easy way of referencing your "default" PersistenceManager. If you have not explicitly constructed a PersistenceManager DefaultManager will implicitly call the default constructor upon first use. If you have constructed a PersistenceManager DefaultManager will return your first constructed instance.
You can also set the PersistenceManager to be referenced as your DefaultManager. Once set, the PersistenceManager you've indicated will be returned as the "default".
When using DefaultManager without having first constructed an instance with the connection and data source extension of your choice, you lose the ability to catch and diagnose any connection problems to your PersistenceServer, since is called implicitly.
Note: If you are using multiple PersistenceManagers in your application you may want to explicitly set this property. If an implicitly assigned PersistenceManager is no longer in use its memory will not be released as long as it is still referenced by this property.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityTypeInfo
member.summary: Helper class used in construction of dynamic entities and to retrieve information about an Entity Type.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityTypeInfo.GetDataSourceKeyName(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns the DataSourceKeyName for a specified EntityType.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityTypeInfo.GetByType(System.Type)
member.summary: Return the EntityTypeInfo for a specified type.
member.remarks: In most environments there will only be a single EntityTypeInfo schema per type. However, it is possible when using UDF's to have one EntityTypeInfo per type per DataSourceExtension. This overload assumes an empty datasource extension corresponding to the default PersistenceManager.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityTypeInfo.GetByType(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Return the EntityTypeInfo for a specified type and data source extension.
member.remarks: In most environments there will only be a single EntityTypeInfo schema per type. However, it is possible when using UDF's to have one EntityTypeInfo per type per DataSourceExtension.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityTypeInfo.GetByDynamicTypeKey(System.String)
member.summary: Return the EntityTypeInfo for a dynamic type.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityTypeInfo.GetByDynamicAssemblyName(System.String)
member.summary: Return the EntityTypeInfo for the specified assembly name containing a dynamic type.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityTypeInfo.ConvertDynamicAssemblyNameToTypeKey(System.String)
member.summary: Return the dynamic type name for the specified assembly name containing the dynamic type.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityTypeInfo.GetAllDynamicTypes
member.summary: Return a list of EntityTypeInfo objects.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityTypeInfo.GetPrototypeTable(System.Type)
member.summary: Return a "prototype" of the EntityTable containing the entity type.
member.remarks:
Replaces EntityTable.GetPrototypeTable(Type).
In most environments there will only be a single EntityTable schema per type. However, it is possible when using UDF's to have one prototype per type per DataSourceExtensions.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityTypeInfo.GetPrototypeTable(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Return a "prototype" of the EntityTable containing the entity type. In most environments there will only be a single EntityTable schema per type. However, it is possible with UDF's and to have one prototype per type per DataSourceExtensions.
member.remarks:
The prototype table is not contained in the PersistenceManager cache and does not contain objects.
Replaces EntityTable.GetPrototypeTable(Type, string).
In most environments there will only be a single EntityTable schema per type. However, it is possible when using UDF's to have one prototype per type per DataSourceExtensions.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityTypeInfo.SetPrototypeTable(IdeaBlade.Persistence.EntityTable,System.String)
member.summary: Assign the prototype table to an EntityTypeInfo object.
member.remarks: Replaces EntityTable.SetPrototypeTable().
